AddressSQLite¶

class AddressBook.AddressDatabaseSQL.AddressDatabaseSQL[source]¶

Interface for storing and managing Object belonging to the Address Dataclass in SQL-Databases. Every entry gets an id assigned to them as their primary key. Firstname and Lastname are required.

SQL-Dialect: SQLite.

Functionalities include loading databases and getting, deleting, adding or updating entries.

__init__()[source]¶

Initialize the AddressDatabaseSQL object with empty filepath connection and cursor object. The table name used in the database file is called Address.

add_address(address)[source]¶

Add a new address to the address book, ensuring no duplicates are added.

Parameters:

address (Address) – The address to add.

Returns:

The ID of the newly added address, 0 if an error occurs or -1 if it already exists.

Return type:

int

close()[source]¶

Closes the cursor object and the connection to the SQL-Database. Outputs the error in case any occur.

delete(id_)[source]¶

Deletes an address by its ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the address to delete.

Returns:

The ID of the deleted address if found and removed, otherwise None.

Return type:

int, None

get(id_)[source]¶

Retrieve an address by its ID.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID of the address to retrieve.

Returns:

The address if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

Address, None

get_all()[source]¶

Return all address entries as a dictionary.

Returns:

A dictionary where keys are IDs and values are AddressBook objects.

Return type:

dict[int, Address]

get_todays_birthdays()[source]¶

Get all addresses of persons who have their birthday today.

Returns:

A dictionary where keys are IDs and values are Address objects with matching birthdays.

Return type:

dict[int, Address]:

is_duplicate(address)[source]¶

Check if an address is a duplicate based on first name, last name, and email.

Parameters:

address (Address) – The address to check for duplicates.

Returns:

True if a duplicate is found, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

open()[source]¶

Establish the connection to the SQL-Database file specified by the filepath attribute and creates a cursor object. Calls the setup_table method to create a table (if not already existing) with the name specified by the tablename attribute. Outputs the error in case any occur.

Raises:

sqlite3.Error – Trigger when an error comes from sqlite3

save()[source]¶

Commits all changes done to the SQL-Database. Outputs the error in case any occur.

search(search_string, field='')[source]¶

Search for a given string across all fields of the database and returns matching entries. Additionally, takes the field string to restrict the search to a specific field. The Search is done case-insensitive and non-exact (utilizes the LIKE statement with wildcards).

Parameters:

  • search_string (str) – The string to search for across all fields or restricted to one field.

  • field (str, optional) – The field to search within (e.g., “firstname”, “lastname”, “email”). Defaults to an empty string (“”), resulting in a search across all fields.

Returns:

A dictionary containing matching address entries with IDs as keys.

Return type:

dict[int, Address]

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified field is invalid (i.e., not in the allowed columns)

set_filepath(filepath)[source]¶

Set the file path for the SQL-Database that contains the address data. Ensures a .db file is used.

Parameters:

filepath (str) – The path to the SQL-Database file.

setup_table()[source]¶

Creates a table in the currently specified filepath with all fields given in the Address dataclass and an automatically increasing id as the primary key. Doesn’t create in case there already is one with the name in the tablename attribute.

update(id_, **kwargs)[source]¶

Update fields of an address by its ID and keyword arguments. Raises KeyError if the ID is not found.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – The ID of the address to update.

  • kwargs – Field names and their updated values (e.g., firstname=”John”).

Returns:

The ID of the updated address.

Return type:

int

Raises:

KeyError – If the address with the given ID is not found.
